subtitle: Did you know that humanity is believed to have originated in another galaxy? And that
the first humanoid bipedal men were feline faced extraterrestrials known as Lyrans or Lyrians? The
Lyran extraterrestrial race considered the first humanoid man beings of all galaxies?
Galactic historians have uncovered compelling evidence suggesting that Lyran DNA is present
in all humans, potentially explaining the mysterious "missing link" between humans
and primates. This link may also clarify why Earth is home to such a wide variety of animal species,
including lions, thought to have extraterrestrial origins. The Lyrans are said to have arrived from
another dimension, fleeing the Lyran-Orion Wars, and seeded Earth with lion-like mammals. Some
individuals, known as starseeds, are believed to have incarnations or past lives as Lyrans.
Early Lyran humans come from their home planet, Avyon also called Egoria. The original man had
52 chromosomes. They were known for their tall, slender, athletic builds, standing about 10 feet
in height with a noble and striking appearance. Males typically had more body hair than females,
who had very little body hair apart from their head. Their facial features included
long or short feline ears and flat, feline-like noses, and they lived for 1,000 to 5,000 Earth
years. A feline subset of the Lyrans had more pronounced cat-like facial features. While the
Lyrans often preferred to remain distant and avoid physical contact, their strength and
energy were comparable to that of Earth’s lions. They primarily observed from afar,
distinguishing themselves with their feline and lion-like traits, such as vibrant eyes,
which set them apart from earlier Pa-Tal creations like the Carians and Reptilians.
Interestingly, there was something distinct about the Lyran energy of this human race. They
are dynamic, highly spirited, witty, fast, and bursting with spontaneity. This energy
signature is characteristic of their lineage. All races that spread across the galaxy from the Man
system carry this recognizable vibration in their genes and energy fields. With a high frequency,
this energy can manifest in two ways: as a restless drive for speed and adventure,
often overwhelming, or as a high-level hermetic vibration of spiritual wisdom. In either form,
they can be difficult to connect with unless one can match their frequency.
Through countless genetic engineering cycles with bipedal mammals resembling apes,
the humanoid form known as the cosmic Adamic human
emerged however it was an upright lion mammalian man. This genetic lineage, known as the "Royal
Line of Egoria" or the "House of Avyon," became more prevalent than the purebred Felines.
With their elevated consciousness, the Lyrans have an extraordinary ability to manipulate nature and
their environment, bending it to their will. They cultivated vast gardens, practiced bio-farming,
and created living architecture drawn from the essence of forests and grasslands,
reflecting their nomadic tribal way of life. While many Lyrans embraced a rich, sensual,
and harmonious existence, others formed the first royal monarchies in their more
technologically advanced societies, setting them apart from their nomadic kin.
For millions of years, the Lyran civilization flourished, with their empire spanning from
the Vega constellation to the star systems of Vulpecula, Hercules, Draco, and Cygnus. Vega,
the brightest star in Lyra, was home to their celestial capital planet,
Avyon. Also called Egoria, Avyon was a paradise planet similar to modern-day Earth,
boasting mountains, lakes, rivers, oceans, and diverse ecosystems teeming with life.
Lyra is the original home to a vast array of worlds and is the main cradle
of the first humanoid species known as man. No equivalent name exists for this constellation,
as the lion that forms in Earth's sky is merely a visual alignment unique to the
planet. Although many "MAN" worlds are connected to some of the oldest cultures in the cosmos,
there are four main humanoid races related to earth humans known as The Taali, The Ahel,
The Noor, and The Laani. A wide variety of non-humanoid species also inhabit this region,
including pacifist indigenous reptoid races like the Afim Spiantsy. Considered master races, the
two primary genetic strands evolving from these four worlds shaped much of the planetary systems.
The Man star system, also known as K62, is located 1,200 light-years away and
is the birthplace of an extremely ancient humanoid culture. From here,
this civilization spread throughout the galaxy, seeding worlds from Avyon to eventually Earth.
The star near their home planet was named "Mana," meaning "the mother."
The four first humanoid races of man, have lyran ancestry. The first Man race of lyrans are the
Laani or.... Laan Lyrans, a lion feline-hybrid species. The skin tones and body hair of the
Laani ranged mainly from very light olve skin and occasionally blue to golden brown,
and they have head hair colors that range from blonde, red, and dark brown. These 12 foot tall
beings were covered in smooth, short fur, giving them a humanoid appearance with
prominent feline lion features. Their lifespan is 1000 to 5000 earth years,
They have eyes in a variety of shades, with amber and turquoise being the most common.
They are graceful and value beauty, culture, and art, especially music and poetry.
The Laani are among the first to establish planetary colonies and ancient foundations
until the Ciakahrr invasion decimated their population. Survivors escaped to the third planet,
Omankhera, which was home to the Taali and served as the central hub of the system.
Their homeworld, Egoria, was devastated, its lush vegetation stripped and transformed into
a reptilian mining facility. Egoria's unique flora displayed colors not seen anywhere else,
such as golden magentas, pinks, and purples, while the purple sky shimmered with multiple
moons surrounding. The Laani built cities from crystalline materials and cherished beauty,
culture, and the arts, particularly music and poetry. They played an active role in the Galactic
Federation of Worlds, making significant contributions to galactic diplomacy.
During a pivotal moment in the Orion Wars, A Laani Prince who had golden red hair and
blue skin named Alerion of House Ra’Teth, known for his visionary leadership and
peaceful diplomacy, sought alliances with the neighboring Andromedan Galaxy. With
the Lyrans stretched thin across many star systems, Alerion realized that brute force
would no longer win the war against the overwhelming Draconian forces of Orion.
He traveled to the great Council of Andromeda, negotiating a secret pact that would provide
Lyran forces with access to Andromedan stargate technology. This would allow the Lyran royals
to move their forces across vast distances in an instant, outflanking the Orion forces. It is said
that the agreement came at great personal cost, as Prince Alerion had to offer his family’s ancient
crown, an artifact of immense cosmic power, as collateral to the Andromedan High Council.
This bold move turned the tide of the war temporarily, giving Lyran
forces a much-needed advantage. However, the crown’s absence left House Ra’Teth vulnerable,
as their power and influence waned without the sacred relic. Though
Alerion succeeded in his goal, the fate of the house hung in balance for centuries.
One group of escaped Lyrans found refuge in the vast Andromeda galaxy. Here,
amid the swirling nebulae and the cosmic energy of a new realm, the Lyran settlers
began to evolve. Over millennia, the energies of Andromeda reshaped them,
transforming them into a race we now know as the Andromedans.
These Andromedans inherited the core spiritual teachings of the Lyrans—peace,
harmony, and the sacred balance of the universe. Yet they went further. In the Andromeda galaxy,
they became more ethereal, their consciousness expanding beyond the physical realm. While the
Andromedans grew in the Andromeda galaxy, another group of Lyrans journeyed to the Arcturus star
system, one of the brightest beacons in the night sky. There, under the light of Arcturus,
the Lyran settlers began to evolve again, shaped by the unique vibrations of their new home.
In time, they became the Arcturians, one of the most spiritually advanced and technologically
proficient civilizations in the galaxy. The Arcturians embraced the Lyran legacy
of wisdom, but their evolution took a different path. They became renowned for
their mastery of healing, energy work, and ascension technologies. However,
Omankhera soon became the target of another invasion by the Draconian Empire.
The Taal, also known as Taali, originate from the safari homeworld in the Man system, known
as Oman Khera. Predecessors to the Ahel, the Taal display a striking diversity in their skin tones
compared to the Laani. Taali typically have darker golden brown shades of fur and skin with spirally,
wooly, or curly lion like hair, along with subtle feline features. Once a fearless warrior race,
they have since evolved into a more peaceful and civil society. Tall, athletic, and spiritual, the
Taali are pacifists who live by a strict code of ethics, which sometimes leads others to mistakenly
perceive them as cold or emotionless due to their reserved nature. On their home planet, Oman Khera,
the Taali governed the Man system under a hierarchical monarchy. This structure consisted
of a ruling monarch presiding over a council of 25, followed by an assembly of 300 senators.
The Taali and Laani Lyran people interbred and intermarried on a planet and climate similar
to earth' but 3 times larger called Kasta in the Ashkera system of Vega,
creating a distinctive race known as the Katay and later the native Sirians who have elongated heads,
not to be confused with lyran sirians. These beings are characterized by their
darker carbonated tones from dark browns and red tones with African-Asiatic feline-humanoid
features. All African and Asiatic races on Earth share lineage with the Taali and Laani Lyrans,
the genetic blending between these ancient lyran races manifests in populations that span from East
Africa and the Arabian Peninsula to Southeast Asia tracing their ancestry to this union in Sirius
systems, where they adapted to the environmental conditions of their new worlds. The Katay lifespan
is 1500 to 2000 earth years. They prioritize the arts, spiritual growth, and diplomacy,
placing these values above conquest. Due to their established relationship with the Anakh Atlantean
prince, Enki, the Katay, Sirians and Taali refrain from interfering with Earth. However the reptoid
sirians have joined the Ashtar Collective which is the malovolent group of species in Antarctica.
An important note is that The Katay also interbred with numerous Atlantean royals of
the Anakh Empire. A master royal geneticist named Ningishzidda used the DNA of the Taali Lyrans and
Ahel Pleiadians to give rise to the Mesoamerican, Latin, Pacific islanders and Indigenous peoples of
North and South America, merging the Taali and Pleiadian lineages. From this fusion,
the Naascals, a distinct group of Katay and Laani alongside the Amara Kove peoples,
emerged and established many of the earliest Lemurian Mesoamerican colonies on earth.
The Lyran royal houses were a legendary aspect of the universes galactic history,
revered by many as the progenitors of numerous starseed races, including humans. The Lyran
system, often said to be the cradle of humanoid civilizations, birthed a number of royal houses
whose influence stretched across the cosmos and later into Atlantis and Lemuria on earth.
The House of Ara’Khan is one of the most prominent royal houses of Lyra, known for
its bold leadership and expansionist philosophy. Its lineage traces back to King Zharion Ara’Khan,
a ruler famous for establishing Lyran colonies across the Vega star system. Zharion, often called
“The Sky King,” he is the white giant lion many starseeds see in their dreams, he was a master
strategist and united various star systems under the Lyran banner through diplomacy and military
prowess. King Zharion won an ancient duel with reptilian emperor Sauron however Sauron survived
this deadly encounter. King Zharion Ara’Khan, the most revered ruler of the House of Ara’Khan,
met a tragic end during the latter stages of the Orion Wars. Despite his great strategic mind,
Zharion’s decision to confront the Draconian fleet head-on proved to be his downfall. In the Battle
of Vega, Zharion’s fleet was overwhelmed by the sheer force of the Draconians’ advanced weaponry.
The death of King Zharion sent shockwaves throughout the Lyran civilization. His son,
Prince Kael Ara’Khan, assumed leadership but was unable to fully recover the strength of
the Ara’Khan house. Nonetheless, Zharion’s legacy as the Sky King and his role in expanding Lyran
influence across the galaxy remains a source of inspiration for future generations. His reign is
remembered for the Golden Age of Lyra, a time of technological advancements and flourishing
trade routes across the galaxy. Groups of the ancient house had colonies on earth.
The House of Veloris is known for its mystical and spiritual rulers. Queen Seraphel Veloris,
one of its most famous leaders, was said to have a deep connection to the cosmic
energies, allowing her to communicate with higher-dimensional beings. Under her guidance,
the Lyrans explored esoteric knowledge, mastering energy-based technologies and unlocking the
mysteries of consciousness. The Veloris dynasty is known for its focus on spiritual growth and
the expansion of interdimensional travel. Legends tell of Seraphel’s ability to traverse the astral
realms and consult with the Galactic Council of Light. Princess Ilyara of the Lyran house
Ky’Solar was known not only for her beauty but also for her mastery of cosmic dance—an ancient
Lyran art form that combined martial skill with the flow of cosmic energies. During the height
of the Orion Wars, the Draconians launched a direct attack on the capital of her homeworld,
hoping to shatter the morale of the Lyran people by capturing their royal seat.
Instead of hiding, Princess Ilyara chose to meet the invaders herself. On the steps
of the crystal palace, she engaged in a cosmic dance that radiated energy across
the battlefield. Each movement of her body channeled the force of stars and galaxies,
turning the energy of her enemies’ weapons back against them. Her
dance became a devastating defense, cutting through the Draconian legions.
The battle became a legend across the Lyran systems, as Princess Ilyara stood alone in
a sea of destruction, her dance flowing like an ancient celestial river, today
her people still believe that she dances among the stars, forever watching over Lyran worlds.
The House of Tykarr is a warrior dynasty, renowned for its martial prowess and discipline. The King
Aelion Tykarr led the Lyran forces during the Orion Wars, a series of cataclysmic conflicts that
pitted the Lyran Federation against the reptilian Draconian Empire. Known as the “Shield of Lyra,”
King Aelion’s leadership was instrumental in defending the Lyran colonies from Draconian
invasions. Although the war eventually led to the destruction of many Lyran worlds, the Tykarr house
remained resolute, forging alliances with other galactic powers to push back the reptilian threat.
The House of Xolaris is associated with the intellectual and scientific advancements of
Lyra. Queen Amara Xolaris was an influential leader, credited with the invention of torsion
field technologies that allowed the Lyrans to harness free energy from the fabric of
space-time. This technology played a crucial role in creating advanced starships capable of
interstellar travel. Queen Amara’s reign was marked by an era of enlightenment,
where exploration and knowledge were held as the highest virtues. The Xolaris house also worked
closely with the Andromedans, Arcturians to ensure peace and stability in the Lyran territories.
The House of Kaelor ruled the oldest and most sacred lands of the Lyran system,
often referred to as the “Heart of Lyra.” King Arion Kaelor is remembered as the unifier of the
Lyran houses. Before his reign, the Lyran system was divided among various factions. Through a
combination of diplomacy and military action, Arion forged alliances between the royal houses
and established a cohesive Lyran Federation. His greatest achievement was the signing of the
Covenant of Lyra, a peace agreement between the royal houses that lasted for millennia,
his descendant is Tybarion of Sirius, the forefather lyran of the Anakh atlantean empire.
The exile of House Kaelor is seen as a bittersweet chapter in Lyran history.
While the destruction of their homeworld marked the end of the Lyran Empire,
it also led to the spreading of Lyran wisdom and knowledge across the galaxy. Many starseeds
on Earth today claim to have ancestral connections to the royal house of Kaelor.
One of the most significant events in Lyran history is the Orion Wars. These
wars spanned millennia, with numerous kings and queens from
different royal houses contributing to the defense of the Lyran star systems.
King Aelion Tykarr’s leadership during the final stages of the Orion Wars is legendary.
His tactical brilliance and alliances with the Pleiadians and Andromedans helped turn
the tide of the war. The ultimate victory came at a great cost—the Lyran homeworld
was destroyed in a final cataclysmic battle, leading many Lyrans to flee
to other parts of the galaxy, including the Pleiades, Sirius, and Earth.
Urant, the fourth planet in the Ashkera system, is a massive gas giant,
hostile to carbon-based life but home to acid-based organisms. Of its many moons,
only two possess magnetic fields capable of supporting the development of ecosystems. One
of these is Urantika, the homeland of the Uraman. The Uraman are a stunning hybrid race, born from
Laan refugees who escaped the Man system in the Lyra constellation. Over time, the dominant Laani
genes overtook the native Urantikan population, blending the original humanoid race into obscurity
and causing them to lose their distinctive feline traits. Despite this, the Uraman thrived,
expanding their influence to the Ashkeran triple-star system. They are widely recognized
for their expertise in genetics, their profound wisdom, and their diplomatic prowess.
Shayat Akura, the seventh moon of Shayat, stands as the habitable heartland of the
Urmah Lyrian people—prime descendants of Earth’s majestic lions and cats, bearing their fierce,
regal features expcept are humanoids. These feline beings share an ancient lineage with the Uraman,
their kin, both tracing their roots to proud laani colonies. Together, they journeyed from their home
on Shayat’s moon, having once roamed the tribal lands of Egoria. The Urmah are a people of
unwavering pride, guided by a code of deep respect and honor. While they are inherently peaceful,
they are unafraid of battle, willing to go to war to defend their world with fearless resolve.
Integral members of the Galactic Federation, the Urmah actively participate in the Starseed
Envoy Program—a mission of guidance and support not only for worlds once
dominated by the Nebu Empire but for any civilization seeking aid. However,
only Stage 3 Directive worlds qualify for such intervention. Earth's envoy program,
in particular, sees a significant presence of Urmah Laan, renowned for their warrior spirits
and steadfast commitment to truth. These envoys carry an oath to expose and dismantle deception,
lies, and manipulation, standing as guardians of integrity across all realms.
The Almeyron system is 205 light-years away, composed of 7 planets, with the
main one being twice as massive as your Jupiter and taking 407 days to orbit.
The second important planet is also quite large, orbiting every 111,000 days. Three
planets in this system are inhabited by man colonies. Borog Uruz System is 440
light-years from Earth, with two planets populated by reptiloids and a Laan Colony.
In the Daran System, there are 6 planets, home to a reptiloid species. The Elhaziel System is a
trinary system composed of a yellow star orbiting a binary pair, populated by Noor Humanoids.
Elfrak Daal System consists of 4 planets and is inhabited by Taal humanoids. In the Ataman System,
a 4-planet system, many unique life forms exist, although none have yet reached a galactic-level
civilization, but human colonies of Taal and Ahel have set up outposts in this system.
The Diriz system is composed of 3 planets and is occupied by reptiloids and Laan
humanoid subspecies. The Hargaliat system has 3 planets as well, except only one is
habitable for a proper civilization. The colonies here are a biracial branch of
Taali and Laani humanoids known as Ayal, they avaricious features of skin color,
hair colors and lineages all winding back to the lyrans.
The Ring Nebula is a place of inter dimensional
vortex, offering easy access to a multitude of destinations. This prized strategic portal was
the main motivation for the Ciakhrr Empire's invasions, ransacking the man system for its
abundance of resources, but primarily because the humanoid civilization there guarded access to the
vortex. After the conquest by the Ciakhrr Empire, an agreement was made with the Taal government to
reassert an outpost in the Nebula on their behalf. All of humanity shares Lyran ancestry,
but specific races trace their lineage to distinct Lyran bloodlines.
The African and Asiatic Indo populations have genetic ties to the ancient Taali Lyrans,
their descendants the Katay, and the technologically advanced Sirians.
These influences shaped the spiritual and resilient nature of Afro-Asiatic peoples.
In the Middle East and Asia, a blend of Taali, Laani, and Ahel lineages contributed
to the formation of Afro-Asiatic and Greco-Indo-European civilizations,
blending strength, adaptability, and spiritual leadership.
Europeans trace their ancestry to the Laani Lyrans and the Ahel/Noor races, passing down traits like
pale skin, creativity, and a focus on diplomacy, which shaped European innovation and culture.
Indigenous American populations resulted from the fusion of Taali Lyran, Ahel Pleiadian,
and Mesoamerican genes, creating deeply spiritual cultures that
maintained a strong connection to their land and cosmic heritage.
The Atlantean Anakh royal family of Anu and Alalu are royal hybrids of Draconian reptilian
and Lyran Sirians. The popular group of ancient aliens who came to earth and engineered mankind.
Today, many humans still carry Lyran genetic markers or they are Lyran starseeds who have
lived past lives as Lyrans or apart of the lineage. These ancient genes,
woven into the DNA of modern populations, are thought to influence physical traits,
spiritual inclinations, and even cultural expressions. Whether in physical characteristics,
like skin tone and hair type, or in a deeper, inherited connection to the cosmos, the presence
of Lyran genes of the first men from another dimensions continues to shape human diversity
across the planet with all feline creatures on this planet as seeded as a cosmic reminder.
If you enjoyed this episode, don't forget to like, share,
and subscribe to the channel for weekly content on ancient galactic mysteries, legends of the
astral cosmos, and the hidden esoteric history of the universe and stay tuned for episode 3 of
Emerald Tablets. May the eternal light forever guide your path and see you on the next episode.
